instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
Hello,
The Macbook turns on but no  backlight (Confirmed by a torch that the display is on). The board is clean but found a little bit green beside L7701 but no component seems affected or shorted.
Getting 8.5V on the both sides of L7701.

Is it the feedback trace issue that ll require a jumper or is it something else? How can i verify ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
Inspect XW7720 bridge.
If needed, fix it.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ujATnRVNYO93ifpZD7KPi6_swX4C38RH/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: I dont undertand. Can you please guide me ? What exactly do i check ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
Look at the pics.
You can see damaged connection there; figured with red line.
Is your case?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: The XW7720 point was green. Cleaned that area. Diode Mode Reading to Ground is 0.618 (Red to Ground)

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: Do you have continuity where the red line?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: Continuity between which 2 points? One is the point marked in red and the other ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
There is a red line, not point!
It marks the bridge trace which usually gets corroded.

Look at schematic, to understand what connection to check.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: There was no continuity . Ran a Jumper Wire. But still the same.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
You should check the continuity on the other side of the board.
I'm pretty sure the trace inside the board is broken.
One boardview screenshot shows you how to run the wire.
Scratch the trace near the <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> corner; do not touch its corresponding ball with solder iron.

Just in case, check first if there is continuity.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message: Did that too but still no light. LCD is good. Checked that

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
threads.message:
You may need to change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> too.
It may have corroded balls..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Light Issue
